thread.title: Bologna begged Napoli for mercy on Twitter, but it never came
thread.title_full: Bologna begged Napoli for mercy on Twitter, but it never came

title: Bologna begged Napoli for mercy on Twitter, but it never came
text:
Feb 4, 2017 at 5:07p ET 0Shares 
Nobody could have imagined exactly what went down when Napoli and Bologna squared off on Saturday. The first half alone featured five goals, two red cards and one missed penalty. A few more oddities here and there and we could have had a new Christmas carol. 
The first half ended 1-4 in favor of Napoli, the visiting team on the day. Unfortunately for Bologna, the visitors werenâ€™t very cordial guests. They poured on some more pain. 70 ðŸ˜Ÿ' And it doesn't stopâ€¦ Hamsik picks out the top corner for his second of the night. Now we're gonna have to win 6-5. #BFCNapoli 1-5 
â€” Bologna FC 1909 (@BolognaFC1909en) February 4, 2017 
Marek Hamsik picked up his brace in the 70th, and with a four-goal lead surely Napoli would pump the brakes, right? Nahhh. Hamsik wanted his hat trick, and he got it just two minutes later. At that point, Bolognaâ€™s Twitter account just wanted it to stop. 72' Ok come on now, we've had enough. Hamsik with a screamer for his hat-trick. You can take him off now. #BFCNapoli 1-6 #EnoughOfThat 
â€” Bologna FC 1909 (@BolognaFC1909en) February 4, 2017 
Whatâ€™s the Twitter equivalent of raising the white flag? Iâ€™m guessing thatâ€™s it. Bologna begged for mercy, but Napoli didnâ€™t accept. The Partenopei hit lucky goal No. 7. Or unlucky No. 7 if youâ€™re a Bologna fan. 89' Nobody ever scores seven, it's unrealistic but sadly true. Mertens with the goal. Restart the console, TV or whatever. #BFCNapoli 1-7 
â€” Bologna FC 1909 (@BolognaFC1909en) February 4, 2017 
Rest easy, though. The Bologna account is optimistic about the future! FT Bologna 1-7 Napoli 
â€” Bologna FC 1909 (@BolognaFC1909en) February 4, 2017 
The social media producer even had time to throw some totally unnecessary, but hilarious, shade at Wigan. Nope. A good point well made. Always could have gone worse though. We could have been @LaticsOfficial and lost 9-1. https://t.co/ZxzTk7vYSJ 
â€” Bologna FC 1909 (@BolognaFC1909en) February 4, 2017 
Ouch. Digging up a match from 2009 to take a swipe at a team thatâ€™s not even in the same country? Thatâ€™s some quality social media-ing.
